course_name: Graduate Diploma in Speech and Language Sciences
overview: Students enrolled in the Master of Speech Pathology (C04386) can apply to transfer into this exit-only course after completing 48 credit points of specified study and gain a graduate diploma qualification.
awards: Graduate Diploma in Speech and Language Sciences (GradDipSpLangSc)

learning_outcomes.text: Recognise and explain the principles of practice, scope of practice, and range of practice areas of speech pathologists in Australia; and apply this knowledge in approaching clinical scenarios.

Apply the World Health Organisation's International Classification of Functioning Disability and Health, the Social Determinants of Health, and Models of Disability to clinical scenarios in the field of speech pathology.
Identify the types of research studies conducted in the field of speech pathology, and locate and review these studies to inform their knowledge of the field.
Recognise and apply principles of collaborative and person-centred practice in the field of speech pathology and describe a range of strategies that support engagement in inter-professional teams.
Demonstrate effective interpersonal communication in the field of speech pathology and apply this in their clinical placement learning opportunities with children and families.

notes: This is an exit-only course. There is no direct admission to it. Current UTS students may be able to submit an Internal Course Transfer (Graduating) application to exit with this course. See the Course transfer page for further details.
admission_requirements: None; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
course_structure: This course comprises a total of 48 credit points.
